intro: Goniocladus petiolatus, commonly known as the slender-stemmed goniocladus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes cashew and poison ivy. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, opposite leaves. It produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. The fruit is a drupe, typically containing a single seed enclosed in a hard, woody shell.
